title: Nanotech Cleanroom Adventure #86
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Decontamination Airlock
rooms.description: A pristine white chamber with glowing blue UV lights overhead. Air filtration systems hum quietly. Sterile suits hang on the wall next to a decontamination shower. A digital display shows particle count readings. The air smells of ozone and antiseptic.

items.name: equipment storage locker
items.description: A white metal locker with two compartments for cleanroom supplies

items.name: cleanroom safety protocol
items.description: A laminated document with safety procedures
items.text: CLEANROOM PROTOCOL: Maximum allowable particle size is 100 nanometers. Lead researcher: Dr. Sarah Chen. Project: Nanoforge synthesis of medical nanobots. Storage location: Cryogenic vault in main lab.

items.name: security access card
items.description: A white plastic card with a magnetic strip labeled 'AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL'

items.name: decontamination shower
items.description: A glass-enclosed shower with chemical spray nozzles

items.name: waterproof research note
items.description: A sealed note attached to the shower wall
items.text: Reminder: The nanoforge requires three authentication factors. Remember - who leads this project, what we're creating, and where we store the samples. -Dr. Chen

items.name: particle count display
items.description: A digital screen showing real-time air quality measurements
items.text: PARTICLE COUNT: 0.003 particles per cubic meter. MAXIMUM ALLOWED: 100nm. STATUS: OPTIMAL

items.name: pressurized airlock door
items.description: A heavy door with a card reader and pressure seal. Red lights indicate it's locked.

rooms.name: Main Cleanroom Laboratory
rooms.description: A vast sterile laboratory with white walls and floors. Electron microscopes, centrifuges, and analysis equipment line the workbenches. A massive sealed chamber labeled 'NANOFORGE' dominates the far wall. Robotic arms hang from the ceiling. Everything gleams under bright LED lighting.

items.name: research workbench
items.description: A stainless steel bench covered with scientific instruments and sample containers

items.name: small lab key
items.description: A key with a biohazard symbol etched on it

items.name: sealed equipment cabinet
items.description: A locked cabinet containing sensitive research materials

items.name: project research log
items.text: PROJECT LOG - Dr. Sarah Chen: We are developing medical nanobots for targeted drug delivery. The prototypes are stored in the cryogenic vault. Today we achieved a breakthrough in the nanoforge synthesis process. The final activation sequence is critical.

items.name: electron microscope station
items.description: A sophisticated microscope with a viewing screen showing nanoscale structures
items.text: SAMPLE ANALYSIS: Nanobot prototype dimensions: 100nm diameter. Structure: Medical delivery capsule. Status: Ready for synthesis.

items.name: research computer terminal
items.description: A workstation with multiple monitors displaying research data
items.text: SYSTEM LOG: Nanoforge chamber requires authentication. Security protocols active. Only authorized researchers may access synthesis controls.

items.name: nanoforge chamber door
items.description: A massive reinforced door with a biometric scanner and security terminal. Three authentication questions are displayed on the screen.

password_questions.question: Who is the lead researcher?
password_questions.hint: Check the safety protocol and project log

password_questions.question: What is being created?
password_questions.hint: The project log describes the research goal

password_questions.question: Where are samples stored?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents mention the storage location

rooms.name: Nanoforge Synthesis Chamber
rooms.description: You've reached the heart of the facility! A cylindrical chamber filled with swirling plasma and electromagnetic fields. Robotic manipulators position atoms with impossible precision. On the central platform, a glowing vial contains the completed batch of medical nanobots - tiny machines that will revolutionize medicine. Mission accomplished!

items.name: nanoforge synthesis core
items.description: The main synthesis chamber where nanobots are assembled atom by atom

items.name: completed nanobot sample
items.description: A sealed vial containing millions of medical nanobots, glowing with a faint blue light

items.name: synthesis control panel
items.description: The master controls showing successful completion of the synthesis process
items.text: SYNTHESIS COMPLETE: 1,000,000 medical nanobots produced. Quality: 100%. Status: Ready for clinical trials. Project success!

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You've navigated the cleanroom protocols and successfully completed the nanobot synthesis! The medical nanobots you've created will save countless lives through targeted drug delivery. Dr. Chen's research is complete, and you've proven yourself as a capable nanotechnology researcher. You win!
